description: "Designing For Android: Tips And Techniques" is an in depth blog post with many best practices when designing for Android. Especially when you have to design for multiple resolutions.
title: Designing For Android

description: In this blog post Jernej Virag explains all the must have libraries a Android developer should know. Very similiar to our toolbox, but great summaries and explanations of each library.
title: Must-have libraries

description: Sixth part of Mark Allisons "Maven and Android" series.
title: Maven and Android series

description: Synchronized Scrolling by Xavi Rigua is a library project that allows you to have a Synchronized scrolling effect in a view, similar to the one in the GMail app (when you open a conversation with multiple messages, you can scroll down and the senders info stay on top of screen).
title: Synchronized Scrolling Library

description: Sergey Tarasevich has a library on Github that helps you to share your content in Facebook or Twitter.
title: Android-Simple-Social-Sharing

description: Universal Image Loader (also by Sergey Terasevich) is a reusable and powerful component for asynchronous image loading, caching and displaying.
title: Android-Universal-Image-Loader

description: An official writing style guide has been released by Google. Most of it is common sense, but it is a good nudge to revisit your copy.
title: Writing Style

description: Let's face it: Juggling with densities for Android is a bit of a pain, especially when dealing with 9 patch png. And then comes this tool, that takes a xhdpi PNG file, or 9.png file, and generates ldpi, mdpi and hdpi png files automatically. Great work!
title: 9Patch Resizer

description: Android development contests are an excellent opportunity to showcase your design and development talents. In this blogpost Michelle Greenline lists three of them.
title: Three Upcoming Android Development Contests
